results.title: The Bif if
results.creator_credit: Vivienne King and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Looks at research being done on the drug Interferon. It is a substance that has been shown to have an effect on some viruses and tumors and scientists are hopeful that it will cure cancer and other life threatening diseases. A cheap synthetic version, if developed, would enable scientists to meet current world demand.

results.title: The Best time of my life
results.brief_description: Women in mid-life share their thoughts and experiences of menopause. This film provides role models who demonstrate that there is life after menopause.

results.title: The Best thing about conflict (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, ABC-TV (Australia), Monash University and Open Learning Agency of Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
Conflict is a necessary and everyday reality in many organisations and has the potential for both positive and negative outcomes. Managers should aim to both use and resolve conflict and develop effective negoatiation skills. In this episode we find out that conflict is usually unwelcome but sometimes constructive depending on how it is managed.

results.title: The Best of zoom Martha
results.brief_description: Looks at the life of Martha Rudolph, a teenager suffering from epilepsy. Shows her positive outlook on life as well as her family’s reactions to her disability. Also mentions that there are degrees of epilepsy and provides a brief explanation of why epileptic fits occur.
results.description: Looks at the life of Martha Rudolph, a teenager suffering from epilepsy. Shows her positive outlook on life as well as her family’s reactions to her disability. Also mentions that there are degrees of epilepsy and provides a brief explanation of why epileptic fits occur.

results.title: The Best of Gillies (Captioned)
results.brief_description: The Gillies Team takes on numerous national treasures (including Bob Hawke, Andrew Peacock, Wran the Man and Don Chipp) and even the odd megabuck personality such as Rupert Murdoch in this new compilation video selected from the hilarious Gillies Report series. Highlights include Bob Hawke as the Invisible Man: the Maralinga Commission (or Wise After the Event) re-enacted in the form of a cabaret, with Mr. Justice McLelland chairing the proceedings in sparkling silver lurex; and John Clarke - posing as a sports announcer - introduces us to the magnificent game of Farnarkeling. Featuring: Max Gillies, John Clarke, Patricia Cooke, Tracey Harvey, Don Watson, Geoff Kelso, Wendy Harmer & Phillip Scott. Rated: PG

results.title: The Bessemer converter
results.creator_credit: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare, Film Producers Guild and Merton Park
results.brief_description: This film describes the structure and operation of the Bessemer Convertor for making steel. Shows the raw materials, explains the chemical reactions which occur in the convertor, and points out the difference between basic and acid convertors.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare, Film Producers Guild and Merton Park

results.title: The Bespoke overcoat
results.brief_description: Fender has worked as a clerk for many years in the cold warehouse of Ranting & Co., and wants one of the warm sheepskin overcoats stacked around him. Ranting refuses, and Fender asks his friend Morry the tailor to make a coat for him. However, Fender is fired and dies of cold before the coat is finished. His troubled ghost returns to Morry, and persuades him to help him take what he feels is his due - a sheepskin coat from Ranting’s warehouse.

results.title: The Beginnings of the cinema
results.creator_credit: BFI and National Film Archive (Great Britain)
results.brief_description: This is a representative collection of short films made between 1896 and 1903, comprising: ‘A Train entering a station’ (from the first Lumiere program); ‘The Derby - on the road to Epsom’, R.W. Paul’s film of the 1896 Derby; ‘The Brighton fire’; ‘Panorama of Calcutta’; ‘The Vanishing lady’; ‘Pienture a L’envers’; ‘The Music eccentric’; ‘A Chess dispute’; and ‘The Miller and the sweep’.

results.title: The Beginning : do you dare to differ?
results.brief_description: Designed to stimulate discussion on the role of the creative individual in relation to his society. The non-narrated film describes how one wiggle-man is inspired to do something different from the rest of his companions. Although they ridicule him, the new idea is proven successful, giving the skeptics the courage to try it too.
